instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water damaged
threads.message:
Board had water damage near L7900, <CHIP>U3700</CHIP>, <DIODE>D8410</DIODE> and L7670.

First there was not USB power, after UC I now get USB power but no activity and PPVCCCPU stays at 0.9V and the CPU heats up after a while.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water damaged
threads.message:
L7900 powers PCH and possible overvoltage occured.

Liquid sign at <DIODE>D8410</DIODE> is even worst.
High voltage could affected some data lines...
